availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Josiah "Joseph" H. Lewis (Adair County, Kentucky, farmer and solider)

body.p: Adair County, Kentucky, farmer and solider. Adair County, Kentucky, native. Married to Susan McKinnay Lewis on October 23, 1855. Father of Junius C. Lewis, John Lewis, and James T. Lewis. Farmer in Adair County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from December 31, 1861 to November 14, 1863. Killed at the Battle of Huff's Ferry, Roane County, Tennessee, on November 14, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 1, p. 170.
